channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: EVACUATION WARNING; 10:00PM; MAP: https://www.lafd.org/news/strong-february-rain-storm-hits-los-angeles-area; #ShadowHills; LAFD: A strong storm coming Sunday-Tuesday may trigger a life-threatening debris flow. EVACUATION WARNING: La Tuna Canyon Dr. starting at Martindale to the east, Primrose to the south, Ledge to the west, Horse Haven to the north should prepare to evacuate. This will likely be upgraded to an evacuation order at 8am Sunday. Check lafd.org/alerts for updates. LAFD: Una fuerte tormenta que comience el domingo hasta martes puede provocar flujos de escombros que pongan en peligro la vida. ADVERTENCIA DE EVACUACIÓN: La Tuna Canyon Dr. comenzando en Martindale al este, Primrose al sur, Ledge al oeste y Horse Haven al norte deben prepararse para evacuar. Es probable que esto se actualice a una orden de evacuación a las 8 a.m. del domingo. Consulte lafd.org/alerts para obtener actualizaciones.; Nicholas Prange

Update Confined Space Rescue; INC#1224; 09:30PM; EB 118 Fwy x Laurel Canyon Blvd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/eaWHf1fGHVqxpoR37; #Pacoima; Rescuers thoroughly searched the tunnels/drains/channels and did not locate an injured female, as reported. One adult male was located, but did not wish to receive LAFD assistance in any way. Crews will be picking up the equipment and clearing the scene shortly.; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 E18 E27 E275 E288 E289 E298 E75 E87 E88 E89 EM15 HR3 PI3 RA70 RA75 RA96 SO1 SQ87 T75 T88 T89 T98 UR88 UR89; CH8; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Confined Space Rescue; INC#1224; 06:14PM; EB 118 Fwy x Laurel Canyon Blvd; #Pacoima; One adult female is trapped in a storm drain with unknown injuries. Urban Search and Rescue teams are responding to make entry into the confined space.; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 E18 E27 E275 E288 E289 E75 E87 E88 EM15 HR3 RA70 RA75 RA96 SO1 SQ87 T75 T88 T89 UR88 UR89; CH8; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0930; 02:43PM; 7230 N Medical Center Dr; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/fiAWHCXYzmFZyx2z9; #WestHills; Firefighters found a small fire on the fourth floor of a medical center building, held in check by a fire sprinkler. Forty-six firefighters responded to the modern sealed six-story building and took 26 minutes to access and extinguish the flames, which were well-contained by the sprinklers. Firefighters will be on scene for an extended operation to clear the building of water and smoke. resulting from the fire and sprinklers. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E106 E273 E296 E305 E72 E84 EM17 RA106 RA72 RA84 SO1 T105 T73 T96; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0930; 02:43PM; 7230 N Medical Center Dr; #WestHills; Six-story medical center building with fire showing from the fourth floor. Reports of fire sprinkler activations on that floor. Offensive mode.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E106 E296 E305 E72 E84 RA106 RA72 SO1 T105 T96; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0596; 11:23AM; 4418 N Homer St; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/xUY9GqhQjsH27xR18; #MontecitoHeights; Firefighters responded to a one-story home with heavy fire in the attic, and some extension into the living space below. Crews advanced hose lines through crowded rooms with excessive storage to gain access to the fire from below. Additional firefighters ascended ladders to the roof to cut holes for ventilation, and made great progress to extinguish flames with hose lines from above (spraying hose lines down through the holes they made). Ultimately, it took 32 firefighters 20 minutes to eliminate the fire. One occupant escaped in good health. Paramedics provided a medical evaluation as a precaution, but the occupant chose not to accept ambulance transport to the hospital. No further injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E1 E12 E201 E212 E44 RA1 RA12 RA801 SC1 SO1 SQ21 T1 T12; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0596; 11:03AM; 4418 N Homer St; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/xUY9GqhQjsH27xR18; #MontecitoHeights; One-story single family home with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E1 E12 E201 E212 E44 RA1 RA12 RA801 SQ21 T1 T12; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/02/2024 INC#1060

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1060; 03:28PM; 817 S Vermont Av; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/o6f8nudSB6kK3YE28; #Koreatown; The first arriving 34 LAFD Firefighters took just 24 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in the attic of a 3,616 square foot two-story medical office building. No injury. Though there were roofers reportedly performing hot work atop the building, the specific cause of the fire has yet to be determined.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E13 E203 E210 E211 E229 E29 E3 E6 E95 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA6 RA813 RA826 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T10 T11 T29 T3 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1060; 03:04PM; 817 S Vermont Av; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/o6f8nudSB6kK3YE28; #Koreatown; PRELIM: Smoke on the second floor of a two-story office building with an apparent attic fire.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E13 E203 E210 E211 E229 E29 E3 E6 E95 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA6 RA813 RA826 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T10 T11 T29 T3 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12, 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0834; 12:57PM; 8800 N Kester Av; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/FDsT6oBN95CbrL8M9; #PanoramaCity; 39 LAFD Firefighters took just 15 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish heavy fire in the attached garage of a two story townhome, preventing flames from extending into the living area, or damaging an adjacent residence. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC12 BC15 E239 E275 E290 E7 E81 E90 RA7 RA75 SO1 T39 T75 T90; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey
